overview: From 2025-10-11 to 2025-10-12, elizaos-plugins/plugin-openai had 1 new PRs (1 merged), 0 new issues, and 2 active contributors.

topPRs.title: refactor: restructure to modular architecture matching openrouter patâ€¦
topPRs.author: 0xbbjoker
topPRs.body:
Refactored the OpenAI plugin from a single 1,253-line file into a well-organized
modular structure following the established plugin-openrouter pattern.

Changes:
- Split monolithic index.ts into focused modules by responsibility
- Created types/ directory for all type definitions
- Created utils/ directory (config, events, audio, json, tokenization)
- Created providers/ directory for OpenAI client instantiation
- Created models/ directory with handlers for each model type
  - text.ts: TEXT_SMALL & TEXT_LARGE handlers
  - embedding.ts: TEXT_EMBEDDING handler
  - image.ts: IMAGE & IMAGE_DESCRIPTION handlers
  - audio.ts: TRANSCRIPTION & TEXT_TO_SPEECH handlers
  - object.ts: OBJECT_SMALL & OBJECT_LARGE handlers
  - tokenizer.ts: tokenizer encode/decode handlers
- Created init.ts for plugin initialization logic
- Moved tests to __tests__/ directory
- Main index.ts reduced from 1,253 to 311 lines

Benefits:
- Improved maintainability with 20-200 line files
- Consistent structure across LLM provider plugins
- Better code organization and separation of concerns
- No breaking changes - full backward compatibility maintained

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Restructures the OpenAI plugin from a monolith to a modular architecture with dedicated model handlers, shared utilities, a provider client, background init validation, and a comprehensive test suite.
> 
> - **Structure**:
>   - Split `src/index.ts` into focused modules: `models/` (text, embedding, image, audio, object, tokenizer), `utils/` (config, events, audio, json, tokenization), `providers/` (`openai` client), `types/`, and `init.ts`.
>   - `src/index.ts` now wires model routes to handler functions and invokes `initializeOpenAI`.
>   - Re-export public APIs from `src/models/index.ts`, `src/providers/index.ts`, and `src/utils/index.ts`.
> - **Functionality**:
>   - Centralized config/helpers (`getBaseURL`, `getAuthHeader`, model selectors, telemetry flag) and event emission.
>   - Extracted handlers for `TEXT_SMALL`, `TEXT_LARGE`, `TEXT_EMBEDDING`, `IMAGE`, `IMAGE_DESCRIPTION`, `TRANSCRIPTION`, `TEXT_TO_SPEECH`, and tokenizer encode/decode.
>   - Provider setup via `createOpenAIClient`; background API key validation in `initializeOpenAI`.
> - **Tests & Env**:
>   - Added `__tests__/plugin.test.ts` covering all model handlers and tokenization; `__tests__/setup.ts`.
>   - Added `.env.test` template; updated `.gitignore` to exclude env and test artifacts.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit e2b956111fd26d40b45f1965602a2ebb724dd617. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- New Features
  - Added text embeddings, small/large text generation, image generation & description, audio transcription, text-to-speech streaming, tokenizer encode/decode, and structured object generation.
  - Background OpenAI initialization with runtime-aware config and telemetry emission.

- Refactor
  - Reorganized OpenAI integration into modular handlers and centralized utilities (config, events, tokenization, audio, JSON repair). Public types re-exported.

- Tests
  - Added comprehensive plugin test suite, test setup, and a test environment template.

- Chores
  - Updated ignore patterns for environment/test artifacts and bumped package version.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topPRs.title: fix: handle Buffer and Node.js streams for voice features
topPRs.author: 0xbbjoker
topPRs.body:
- Accept Buffer input for TRANSCRIPTION model (in addition to Blob/File)
- Convert Web ReadableStream to Node.js Readable for TEXT_TO_SPEECH in Node.js environments
- Fixes compatibility with Discord voice transcription and TTS playback
- Maintains browser compatibility by conditionally converting streams only in Node.js

This allows voice plugins (Discord, Telegram, etc.) to pass Buffer directly
for transcription and receive proper Node.js Readable streams for audio
playback, while keeping the OpenAI plugin as the abstraction layer that
handles format conversions.

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Adds Buffer support for transcription and converts TTS responses to Node.js Readable in Node, improving voice I/O compatibility; bumps version.
> 
> - **Plugin (OpenAI)**:
>   - **Transcription (`ModelType.TRANSCRIPTION`)**:
>     - Accepts `Buffer` input in addition to `Blob`/`File` and param objects.
>     - Auto-detects audio MIME type from buffer; optional `mimeType` override in `OpenAITranscriptionParams`.
>   - **Text-to-Speech (`fetchTextToSpeech`, `ModelType.TEXT_TO_SPEECH`)**:
>     - Converts Web `ReadableStream` to Node.js `Readable` in Node environments.
>     - Validates non-null response body; sets `Accept` for mp3.
>   - **Utilities**:
>     - Adds `detectAudioMimeType` and `webStreamToNodeStream` helpers.
> - **Tests**: Update transcription test to pass `Buffer` input.
> - **Version**: Bump to `1.5.16`.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 9ae4d3e62ce523d8f3f18929f106aea250d76241. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Transcription now accepts Buffer inputs with optional mimeType; audio MIME auto-detection added.
  * Streaming behavior standardized so TTS and transcription return native stream types per environment.

* **Chores**
  * Package version bumped to 1.5.16.
  * Public typings and metadata standardized; minor logging and formatting refinements.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
